meanings.definition: In a manner relating to measuring time
meanings.sent1: She measured the race time chronometrically with a stopwatch.
meanings.sent2: The scientist recorded the data chronometrically using precise instruments.
meanings.sent3: The teacher comically tried to grade the tests chronometrically but ended up confused.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat chronometrically, ticking away the seconds of his life.
meanings.sent5: The clock on the wall moved chronometrically, marking each passing moment.

meanings.definition: Using a chronometer or other timekeeping device
meanings.sent1: The chronometrically controlled experiment ensured accurate results.
meanings.sent2: The ship's navigation was dependent on the chronometrically precise clock.
meanings.sent3: The chef's chronometrically timed recipe resulted in a perfectly cooked meal.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as precise and chronometrically accurate as a well-calibrated clock.
meanings.sent5: The chronometrically synchronized dancers moved in perfect harmony.
